newsitem.title: CANADA: Acquisition, product prices lift Potash.
newsitem.headline: Acquisition, product prices lift Potash.

text.p: Shares of fertilizer company Potash Corp of Saskatchewan Inc surged in Toronto and New York on Tuesday after the company acquired a 51 percent stake in Germany's Kali und Salz Beteiligungs AG for US$164 million.
Analysts said the deal, as well as the Saskatchewan-based firm's plans to raise potash prices, convinced investors to lift its stock price past expectations.
Potash stock in Toronto climbed 6.35 to 117.35 on volume of 548,303 shares. Its New York Stock Exchange-listed shares jumped 4-1/4 to 86-3/8 on 1.1 million shares.
"It's outperformed our expectations for the company," said Todd Hinrichs, analyst with Chicago-based Everen Securities. "Certainly, they're making some very wise acquisitions."
Potash said on Monday it agreed to a deal to purchase the German stake from conglomerate BASF AG after four months of talks.

Analysts have said the acquisition would see Potash gain a major foothold in Europe's fertilizer industry for an attractive price. "This acquisition appears to add more value to the company," Hinrichs said.
Potash has also served clients notice that it planned to raise potash prices by about US$8.00 per ton for coarse grade in February.
Hinrichs said investors were betting the price increase would stick.
